column4: It should tell you that synaptic is already the newest version
Well then you should proabably re-install ubuntu
sudo -i will get you to the #
then you don't need a million sudos
Just be carful not to stay at the # and think twice each time you execute something
do u know the difference between sudo -s and sudo -i?
and btw, ubuntu doesn't support it, you really should not help people with sudo -i. ;)
tritium it's on Ubuntu Wiki, it should not be used
tritium Please do not suggest this to others unless you personally are available 24/7 to support the user if they have issues as a result of running a shell as root.
I do it, but you should not teach people. :P
people tend to solve most problems by running stuff on a root shell. Sometimes they're not ready. ;P
I believe this is not the root of all evils, doing and rm -rf on a root shell. Instead, get used to it as the 'Administrator' account on Windows.
yeah, pain in the ass to do lots of sudos. ;P
